fields.name: Quick Start
fields.description: Get started with the Hydraulic Diagnostic System in minutes

fields.title: Getting Started with Admin Panel
fields.summary: Learn how to navigate and use the Django Admin panel for the first time
fields.content:
# Getting Started with Admin Panel

## Introduction

Welcome to the Hydraulic Diagnostic System! This guide will help you get started with the admin panel.

## Accessing the Admin Panel

1. Navigate to: `http://localhost:8000/admin/`
2. Enter your credentials
3. Click **Log In**

## Dashboard Overview

The dashboard displays:

- **Statistics**: System metrics and usage
- **Quick Actions**: Common tasks
- **Recent Activity**: Latest changes

## Navigation

Use the left sidebar to access:

- üè† **Home**: Dashboard
- üìö **Documentation**: This help system
- üì¶ **Equipment**: Manage hydraulic equipment
- üë• **Users**: User management

## Next Steps

- [Add Your First Equipment](./add-first-equipment)
- [Run a Diagnostic](./run-diagnostic)
- [Configure ML Models](./configure-ml-models)

fields.title: Adding Equipment
fields.summary: Step-by-step guide to adding hydraulic equipment to the system
fields.content:
# Adding Equipment

## Overview

This guide shows you how to add new hydraulic equipment to the system.

## Steps

### 1. Navigate to Equipment Section

From the dashboard, click **Equipment** in the sidebar.

### 2. Create New Equipment

1. Click the **+ Add Equipment** button
2. Fill in the required fields:
   - **Name**: Equipment identifier
   - **Type**: System type (pump, valve, cylinder, etc.)
   - **Serial Number**: Manufacturer serial number
   - **Installation Date**: When it was installed

### 3. Optional Fields

- **Description**: Additional notes
- **Location**: Physical location
- **Maintenance Schedule**: Regular maintenance intervals

### 4. Save

Click **Save** to create the equipment record.

## Data Format

```json
{
  "name": "Hydraulic Pump A-123",
  "type": "pump",
  "serial_number": "SN-2024-001",
  "installation_date": "2024-01-15"
}
```

## Next Steps

- [Upload Equipment Data](./upload-equipment-data)
- [Run Diagnostic Analysis](./run-diagnostic)

fields.title: Understanding GNN Models
fields.summary: Learn about Graph Neural Network models used for hydraulic diagnostics
fields.content:
# Understanding GNN Models

## What are GNNs?

Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) are specialized machine learning models designed to work with graph-structured data.

## Why GNNs for Hydraulics?

Hydraulic systems are naturally represented as graphs:

- **Nodes**: Components (pumps, valves, cylinders)
- **Edges**: Connections (pipes, hoses)
- **Features**: Sensor readings, pressures, flows

## Model Architecture

### Input Layer

Accepts:
- Node features (component state)
- Edge features (flow rate, pressure)
- Graph structure

### Hidden Layers

Perform:
- Message passing between nodes
- Feature aggregation
- Non-linear transformations

### Output Layer

Produces:
- Fault predictions
- Anomaly scores
- Component health metrics

## Training Process

1. **Data Collection**: Gather sensor data
2. **Graph Construction**: Build system topology
3. **Feature Engineering**: Process raw data
4. **Training**: Optimize model parameters
5. **Validation**: Test on held-out data
6. **Deployment**: Use in production

## Performance Metrics

- **Accuracy**: Overall correctness
- **Precision**: False positive rate
- **Recall**: False negative rate
- **F1 Score**: Harmonic mean of precision/recall

## Next Steps

- [Configure GNN Parameters](./configure-gnn-parameters)
- [Train Custom Models](./train-custom-models)

fields.title: API Authentication
fields.summary: How to authenticate with the REST API using JWT tokens
fields.content:
# API Authentication

## Overview

The Hydraulic Diagnostic API uses JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for authentication.

## Getting an Access Token

### 1. Login Endpoint

```bash
curl -X POST http://localhost:8000/api/auth/token/ \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "email": "user@example.com",
    "password": "your-password"
  }'
```

### 2. Response

```json
{
  "access": "eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLC...",
  "refresh": "eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLC..."
}
```

## Using the Access Token

Include the token in the `Authorization` header:

```bash
curl -X GET http://localhost:8000/api/equipment/ \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLC..."
```

## Token Lifetime

- **Access Token**: 1 hour
- **Refresh Token**: 7 days

## Refreshing Tokens

When the access token expires, use the refresh token:

```bash
curl -X POST http://localhost:8000/api/auth/token/refresh/ \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "refresh": "eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLC..."
  }'
```

## Security Best Practices

1. **Never** commit tokens to version control
2. Store tokens securely (environment variables, secure storage)
3. Rotate tokens regularly
4. Use HTTPS in production

## Next Steps

- [API Endpoints Reference](./api-endpoints-reference)
- [Rate Limiting](./api-rate-limiting)

fields.title: Common Errors and Solutions
fields.summary: Troubleshooting guide for frequently encountered issues
fields.content:
# Common Errors and Solutions

## Database Connection Errors

### Error Message

```
django.db.utils.OperationalError: could not connect to server
```

### Solution

1. Check if PostgreSQL is running
2. Verify database credentials in `.env`
3. Ensure `DATABASE_HOST` is correct

## Model Training Failures

### Error Message

```
RuntimeError: CUDA out of memory
```

### Solution

1. Reduce batch size
2. Use CPU instead of GPU
3. Add more GPU memory
4. Enable gradient checkpointing

## API 401 Unauthorized

### Error Message

```json
{
  "detail": "Authentication credentials were not provided."
}
```

### Solution

1. Include `Authorization` header
2. Check token expiration
3. Refresh access token

## File Upload Errors

### Error Message

```
ValueError: Invalid data format
```

### Solution

1. Check file format (CSV, JSON)
2. Validate data schema
3. Ensure proper encoding (UTF-8)

## Getting Help

If you can't resolve the issue:

1. Check the [FAQ](./faq)
2. Search existing documentation
3. Contact support team
4. Submit a bug report

## Support Channels

- **Email**: support@hydraulic-diagnostics.com
- **Slack**: #support channel
- **GitHub**: Create an issue
